title: Le Pen's tightrope: Preparing voters for 'plan B,' without admitting defeat to election ban
summary: Jordan Bardella's assertion that he would run for the far-right Rassemblement National party if Marine Le Pen is barred from doing so has created unease among her loyalists.

title: Strikes could disrupt France's rail traffic throughout next week
summary: Labor action at the state-owned SNCF rail company could disrupt traffic starting Monday, May 5, and until Sunday. Management remains 'fairly confident' about the number of trains running.

title: 'Faced with Donald Trump, is global finance a stabilizing force or an enormous bubble on the verge of bursting?'
summary: The US president plays with the nerves of the markets, with some accusing him of manipulating stock prices. The risk now is that the bubble will burst, writes economist Jézabel Couppey-Soubeyran in her column.

title: For Italians, the conclave marks last hope for a pope from the peninsula
summary: As Italian and generally Western clergy lose influence within Vatican institutions, Italians hope that one of their three cardinals will succeed Pope Francis.

title: Singapore ruling party wins election by a landslide
summary: The People's Action Party majority has become a norm in Singapore's political landscape. Prime Minister Lawrence Wong had urged voters to offer him a strong show of support amid the global economic uncertainties brought on by US President Donald Trump's tough tariffs policy.

title: Desecration or more glory? Joan Didion's private diaries are revealed
summary: Intimate writings by the American author, who died in 2021, have been published in the United States under the title 'Notes to John' without her prior consent. The release rekindles the debate over the legitimacy of posthumous publications.

title: PSG beaten by Strasbourg before Arsenal return leg
summary: Strasbourg won 2-1 against Paris Saint-Germain on Saturday at Stade de la Meinau. PSG have already wrapped up a fourth consecutive Ligue 1 title and saw their unbeaten record domestically this season come to an end last weekend.

title: Sheinbaum says she told Trump 'no' on his offer to send US troops to Mexico: 'Our sovereignty is not for sale'
summary: The US president has long complained that Mexico has not done enough to stop the trafficking of migrants and drugs, particularly fentanyl, into the United States.

title: 21 charged over French prison attacks as investigation narrows in on drug traffickers
summary: The investigation into the attacks including arson and automatic fire has ruled out the involvement of the radical left or foreign interference.

title: Australian left-leaning PM Anthony Albanese claims victory in election
summary: Albanese's Labor Party was on track for an unexpectedly large parliamentary majority, while opposition leader Peter Dutton lost his seat.

title: At the trial of Kim Kardashian's robbers, a septuagenarian enamored with bad boys
summary: Accused of acting as the central link for the team that robbed the American star on October 3, 2016, Christiane 'Cathy' Glotin, 79, recounted the risky romances that led her behind bars on three occasions, including her relationship with Aomar Aït Khedache, 69, described as the 'mastermind' of the operation.

title: Golden Owl solution is revealed, but leaves players of 31-year hunt disappointed
summary: Thirty-two years after the launch of the famous treasure hunt, players finally discovered the solution to the 11 riddles in a documentary. The Owl was buried in Dabo, a town in northeastern France well-known to the players, who were surprised by this 'underwhelming' revelation.

title: A second Paris football club has reached France's first division
summary: Six months after being bought by one of the world's richest families, Paris FC secured its promotion to Ligue 1 on Friday. It is returning to the top flight for the first time since 1979 and hoping to establish a lasting presence there.

title: Founder of Sant'Egidio community fears next pope could undo Francis's legacy
summary: Close to Jorge Mario Bergoglio, the founder of the Catholic movement Sant'Egidio, Andrea Riccardi, expresses his 'pessimism' about the future of the Argentine pontiff's legacy.

title: French mosque stabber was driven by 'morbid fascination,' prosecutor says, ruling out terror
summary: Olivier H., the 20-year-old who killed a Malian man, Aboubakar Cissé, at a mosque in southern France, had posted online about wanting to kill. He is being investigated for 'aggravated murder' with premeditation and targeting 'race or religion.'

title: US to hold military parade on June 14, Trump's birthday
summary: The last major US military parade in Washington was held in 1991 to celebrate the end of the Gulf War. The new parade announcement came a day after Trump said he was declaring May 8 to be Victory Day for World War II and changing Veterans Day, observed on November 11, to Victory Day for World War I.

title: Rapper Ninho breaks records at France's largest stadium
summary: Ninho is the first French-language rapper to fill the Stade de France two nights in a row.

title: Gabon junta chief Oligui sworn in as president
summary: Brice Oligui Nguema, who took power in a coup in 2023, won the presidential election in April with 95% of the vote.

title: Geopolitical crossroads awaits Romania in presidential election re-run
summary: Moscow-aligned political forces backed by the Trump administration have destabilized Romania, a traditionally pro-Western nation. They could come to power in the presidential election on May 4 and 18.

title: Sovereignty rules in 151st Kentucky Derby
summary: It was a first Kentucky Derby victory on Saturday for Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum's Godolphin in their 13th attempt in the 1 1/4-mile Run for the Roses.

title: With strikes at France's national rail company, competitors reap benefits
summary: Rival train companies, airlines, and buses have recorded an increase in bookings for the week of May 5-11, during which strikes are expected at SNCF, France's main railway company.

title: For Jewish cartoonist Joann Sfar, insouciance ended on October 7
summary: The cartoon artist behind 'The Rabbi's Cat' went from being a mere observer of current events to an engaged author, very active on social media. He asserts his Jewish identity and shares his emotion in the face of the resurgence of antisemitism in France. His posts fuel controversy and overshadow his unwavering concern for the plight of the Palestinians.

title: Abducted dad of crypto firm boss freed in French police raid
summary: Prosecutors said police rescued a man kidnapped in Paris by men seeking a ransom from his millionaire son. Five people were arrested.

title: Eve Rodsky, the American helping couples balance the mental load
summary: After narrowly avoiding depression, Eve Rodsky achieved massive success with her book 'Fair Play', which was later adapted into a card game. In the book, the former lawyer develops a method for sharing domestic chores and mental load within households. The bestseller and the game have been translated in numerous countries, but not France.

title: Is it ever a good idea to... wear a football jersey in the city?
summary: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the boundaries that should not be crossed. Or at least, to be aware when crossing them.

title: At Tarántula in Paris, chili peppers reign supreme
summary: This winter, Emmanuel Peña opened a French-Mexican bistro near Bastille in Paris. The self-taught chef offers a dozen spicy dishes inspired by his origins.

title: Macron announces citizens' convention on school schedules, a move met with skepticism
summary: The French president wants to restructure how schoolchildren's time is managed, tackling a highly sensitive issue. Teachers' unions called it a diversion.

title: Kenneth Roth, former head of HRW: 'Human rights can be defended without the United States'
summary: The former executive director of the influential NGO Human Rights Watch says that authoritarian regimes are not indifferent to public opinion pressures for human rights defense. With the Trump administration disengaging, he says in an interview with Le Monde that it is now up to Europeans to take the lead.

title: Missile strikes Israel airport area in Houthi-claimed attack
summary: The missile wounded six people, halted flights and gouged a wide crater, in an attack claimed by the Houthis rebels in Yemen.

title: Erik Prince's art of the pitch
summary: The founder of the infamous private security firm Blackwater is hoping to convince President Donald Trump to let his mercenaries subdue Yemen and transfer the most dangerous American detainees to El Salvador, writes historian Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

title: Small plane crashes into California neighborhood, killing two
summary: Firefighters received reports Saturday afternoon of a single-engine aircraft that had crashed into two houses in Simi Valley, northwest of Los Angeles.

title: Trump says 'I don't know' if he must uphold US Constitution as president
summary: In an interview with NBC News, Donald Trump also said seeking a third term was 'not something I'm looking to do.'

title: 'The trade war creates new opportunities for Europeans and France'
summary: Despite the strong presence of its companies in the US, France could benefit from the current trade chaos, argue Alain Bentéjac and Etienne Vauchez, president and vice president of the think tank La Fabrique de l'exportation.

title: French rail strikes: Traffic will be 'as normal as possible,' says SNCF
summary: With strikes planned next week, the national rail company promised fee-less exchanges and refunds for high-speed trains and advance notification of any cancelations.

title: Iris Knobloch, Cannes Film Festival president: 'For most of my career, I was the only woman at the table'
summary: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a personality about a decisive moment in their life. The former head of Warner Bros. in France looks back on the day she decided to embark on the wild adventure of distributing 'The Artist,' which won five Oscars

title: Champions Cup: Bordeaux beats champions Toulouse to join Northampton in final
summary: Louis Bielle-Biarrey starred as Bordeaux-Bègles beat an injury-struck Stade Toulousain 35-18 to reach their first-ever final.

title: For Muslim-Christian couples, religion isn't always an issue – except around them
summary: In France, interfaith relationships becoming more frequent with each generation. While love transcends religious divides within couples, finding a place within the in-laws' family and agreeing on children's religious practices often pose a challenge.

title: The rise of open relationships among French couples
summary: Maïa Mazaurette notes an increased interest in non-exclusivity in sexual relationships, with the establishment of clear rules to meet the expectations of all parties involved.
